comments.body: what are you trying to do ? are you trying to check if scheduledinterviews is not empty ?? you can do like {% if scheduledinterviews %) Today Interviews{%endif%}
if you want to run your for loop only once you can use slice! like {% interview in scheduledinterviews|slice:"1" %}

{% ifchanged %} works under single loop but i am trying this inside two loops and it does not work. For example-  {% for i in j %}     {% for k in j %} {% ifchanged %}   //something here// {% endifchanged %} {% endfor %} {% endfor %}  but in this case it's not working

answers.body:
You can use the ifchanged tag.

{% ifchanged interview.slot.start.date %}<h4>Today's Interviews</h4>{% endifchanged %}
Sorry to disappoint you but there is no break tag in django template. For me the easiest way to go is to prepare your context data better in the respective view prior to rendering the data.
